business.headline: Why Indians still prefer buying homes during auspicious monthsBuying a home in India is more than just a financial decision — it is an emotional milestone. For many, choosing the right time to invest is as important as picking the right property, with festivals and auspicious dates playing a big role.

Crypto crash wipes out $19 billion after Trump's 100% China tariffs spark sell-offThe cryptocurrency market suffered a historic crash after US President Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on China and new export controls on software.

Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Zeishan Quadri evicted from Salman Khan's show After receiving the least number of votes, 'Gangs of Wasseypur' writer Zeishan Quadri has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19'. Actor Salman Khan announced his exit on 'Weekend Ka Vaar.'

Varun exits No Entry 2 after Diljit, search for new leads underway: Report Actor Varun Dhawan has reportedly left 'No Entry 2' after Punjabi singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh's departure. While Arjun Kapoor is still a part of the cast, the makers are on the hunt for new lead actors.

Akshay doesn't work for more than 8 hours: Abhishek's old clip goes viral A viral clip shows actor Abhishek Bachchan sharing his colleague Akshay Kumar's strict 8-hour workday policy. The clip is from the time the actors appeared on the Kapil Sharma show to promote their 'Housefull 3.'

Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man 2 set for 2026 release. What to expect The second season of 'Your Friendly Neighbourhood Spider-Man' is likely to arrive on Disney+ in 2026. The trailer, shown at New York Comic Con, offered fans a first look at Venom and the return of several characters.

SRK teases KJo on Ozempic, Karan claps back with Wankhede reference Actor Shah Rukh Khan joked about filmmaker Karan Johar's weight loss at the 70th Filmfare Awards on Saturday. Karan responded with a witty Wankhede remark, referencing a controversy.

Kajol wins Internet with 'most epic throwback ever' ft SRK Actor Kajol shared a then-and-now picture with her 'Dilwale Dulhaniya Le Jayenge' co-star Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday. She celebrated their journey by posting a heartfelt message after receiving her seventh Filmfare award.

AI-reimagined Mahabharat to premiere on OTT: When and where to watch India's epic Mahabharat is returning in an AI-reimagined version, premiering on WAVES OTT on October 25 and on Doordarshan from November 2. The series uses advanced AI to recreate the story's characters, battlefields, and moral dilemmas with cinematic scale.

From reels to reality: How Guru Randhawa is turning Instagram into talent hunt Instagram Reels are replacing auditions for singer Guru Randhawa's latest projects. Influencer Ahsii, who recently played lead in Pan India, talked to us about how her viral clip landed her on a music video set.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumours Popstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were spotted kissing on a yacht in California, seemingly confirming dating rumours. The viral pictures come months after their first public outing in Montreal, ending speculation about their relationship status.

Shah Rukh Khan saves Nitanshi Goel as she trips on stage, video goes viral Nitanshi Goel won the Best Debut Female award at Filmfare 2025 for 'Laapataa Ladies', with Shah Rukh Khan and Karan Johar hosting the ceremony. A heartwarming moment went viral when Nitanshi tripped on stage and Shah Rukh quickly came to her rescue.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Vijay Sethupathi rips apart Kamrudin, VJ Parvathy  Bigg Boss Tamil 9 host Vijay Sethupathi called out contestants for their gameplay and failure to manage the week's tasks, especially targeting Kamrudin and VJ Parvathy. His tough comments left Aurora and Parvathy upset, with Sethupathi advising them to maintain dignity while highlighting areas for improvement.

Diane Keaton dies at 79, Leonardo, Jane Fonda and other Hollywood celebs pay tribute Hollywood legend Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather', passed away at 79. Celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, Jane Fonda, and Michael Douglas paid heartfelt tributes, remembering her iconic performances and unique personality.

The Woman In Cabin 10 review: Keira Knightley's high-seas whodunit hits rough watersRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Netflix's latest thriller, 'The Woman in Cabin 10', follows a troubled investigative journalist aboard a luxurious yacht, unravelling a mystery that ultimately feels predictable and lacking in suspense.

Priyanka Chopra captures Nick Jonas helping with her hair, shares adorable video Priyanka Chopra shared an adorable video capturing Nick Jonas helping her with her hair at the airport, giving fans a glimpse of their playful bond.

Deepika Padukone to Allu Arjun: 5 casting controversies in pan-India films From blockbuster expectations to creative clashes, pan-India films bring together stars across industries, but not without their share of controversies, from Deepika Padukone's exits to Allu Arjun's walkouts.

Amitabh Bachchan distributes goodies to fans on his 83rd birthday. Watch Amitabh Bachchan celebrated his 83rd birthday by stepping out to greet fans, breaking his usual Sunday wave tradition, and even distributed goodies to them.

Diane Keaton no more: Priyanka to Kareena, celebs pay tribute to Hollywood icon Hollywood icon Diane Keaton, famous for 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather' series, died at 79, with celebrities like Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor, and Zoya Akhtar paying heartfelt tributes.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 10: Rishab Shetty's film beats Coolie and Saiyaara Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' is unstoppable at the box office, earning Rs 396.65 crore in just 10 days and becoming the third biggest Indian hit of 2025. With strong word-of-mouth and weekend growth, the film is now close to entering the Rs 400 crore club.

Exclusive: Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit Meetha Khaara highlights Agariyas Aditya Gadhvi's new Gujarati folk hit 'Meetha Khaara' highlights salt farmers' struggles in Gujarat. The song continues his mission to showcase underrepresented communities through folk music.

general news.headline: NDA finalises Bihar seat-sharing deal, BJP and JDU to contest 101 seats eachThe BJP and the JD(U) will fight on 101 seats each in Bihar, followed by 29 for Chirag Paswan's LJP (R) and six each for the Rashtriya Lok Morcha (RLM) and the Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM), Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said as he unveiled the NDA's seat-sharing formula.

Deliberately distorted: Mamata Banerjee on shocking Durgapur gang-rape remarkWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, under fire over her shocking remark on the Durgapur gang-rape, claimed her statement was deliberately distorted and an attempt to politically malign her.

Education privilege of a few, free thinking attacked in India: Rahul Gandhi in PeruSpeaking during an interaction, Rahul Gandhi highlighted challenges facing education, social inclusivity, and independent thinking in India.

Alyssa Healy storm hits Vizag, sinks India in record chaseCaptain Alyssa Healy smashed a jaw-dropping 142 as Australia pulled off the highest-ever chase in women's ODI history, hunting down 331 against hosts India in front of a roaring crowd at the ACA-VDCA Stadium on a Super Sunday to remember.

Mount Everest visible from Bihar: Astronaut captures it from spaceThis awe-inspiring perspective comes just as a separate video showing Mount Everest visible from Bihar captured attention across social media, igniting fresh fascination with the world's tallest peak.

Pak reels under Taliban attacks, loses 58 soldiers but beats drums of 'victory'The steep escalation in cross-border tensions between Afghanistan and Pakistan came against the backdrop of Taliban Acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's India visit.

Bihar's village of early deaths shocks nation. Probe on, Delhi team to visitAfter India Today uncovered the health crisis crippling Bihar's Doodh Paniya village, officials rushed to the ground with medical inspections and announced its adoption.

India needs an FDA-style drug regulator — NowIndia's recurring drug scandals expose deep cracks in its regulatory framework. From contaminated syrups to inconsistent quality checks, the country urgently needs a strong, independent FDA-like body to ensure medicine safety and restore public trust.

Bullets and business: How Gujaratis run killer motel dhandho in USGujaratis own over 60% of motels in the US. But the killing of seven Gujaratis linked to the motel business this year reveals the occupational hazards. Motel owners from the US share how they have managed to run the dhandho successfully despite increasing gun violence and racism.

Union Minister Suresh Gopi offers to resign, cites drop in incomeUnion Minister Suresh Gopi expressed his wish to resign from his post, citing a decline in income and recommending BJP leader C Sadanandan Master as his replacement.

4 killed, 20 injured in mass shooting at bar in South Carolina, suspect on the runA mass shooting at Willie's Bar and Grill on St. Helena Island, South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured.

US wants to help China, not hurt it: Trump tones down rhetoric on fresh tariff spatDonald Trump signals calm amid escalating US-China trade dispute, saying America wants to help China, not hurt it, as both nations trade fresh tariff threats.

Katy Perry, Justin Trudeau seen kissing on yacht amid dating rumoursPopstar Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau were spotted kissing on a yacht in California, seemingly confirming dating rumours. The viral pictures come months after their first public outing in Montreal, ending speculation about their relationship status.

Batting woes, 6th bowler issue: Harmanpreet Kaur says India has much to fixIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that the late batting order collapse let the team down in their agonising loss to Australia in Vizag on Sunday, October 12. Australia secured a record win after chasing down 331 in 49 overs.

Not intentional snub: Taliban minister at press meet redo with women journalistsAfter facing sharp criticism for excluding women journalists from a press meet in New Delhi on Friday, visiting Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi on Sunday called another, "inclusive" press conference and offered a clarification for the earlier omission.

Hours away from freedom: Israel prepares for hostages' release under Trump planIsraeli government spokesperson Shosh Bedrosian said Sunday that the country is "hours away from the release of all our hostages", and that Israel has been ready "since Saturday night to receive our hostages".

Kareena Kapoor to Tiger Shroff, celebs light up Manish Malhotra's Diwali partyFashion designer Manish Malhotra kickstarted the festive season by hosting a glamorous Diwali party in Mumbai on Sunday. Kareena Kapoor Khan, Tiger Shroff, and Hema Malini were some of the actors who added star power to the gathering.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Her life in danger: Bengal rape survivor's father seeks transfer to OdishaThe father of the Durgapur rape survivor has urged Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to let him take his bedridden daughter back to Odisha, saying her safety is at risk in Bengal.

Is artificial intelligence fading human memory?Voice assistants remind us of birthdays; apps keep medical records organised. The conveniences of artificial intelligence make life easier but also raise a deeper concern

Akshay doesn't work for more than 8 hours: Abhishek's old clip goes viralA viral clip shows actor Abhishek Bachchan sharing his colleague Akshay Kumar's strict 8-hour workday policy. The clip is from the time the actors appeared on the Kapil Sharma show to promote their 'Housefull 3.'

Madagascar President claims attempted coup, 3 injured in clashes with soldiersTroops from the elite CAPSAT unit urged fellow soldiers to disobey government orders and back the youth-led protests, calling on President Andry Rajoelina to resign.

Kareena Kapoor Khan, Tiger Shroff, and Hema Malini were some of the actors who added star power to the gathering.

Varun exits No Entry 2 after Diljit, search for new leads underway: ReportActor Varun Dhawan has reportedly left 'No Entry 2' after Punjabi singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh's departure. While Arjun Kapoor is still a part of the cast, the makers are on the hunt for new lead actors.

sports.headline: After batting collapse vs AUS, India coach says team has settled, flexible order After the loss to Australia, India coach Amol Muzumdar said that his side's batting order is settled but can be flexible if needed. India failed to capitalise on their momentum and lost to the Aussies in the end.

Nahida Akter backs Nigar Sultana amid batting woes ahead of South Africa clash Bangladesh spinner Nahida Akter has defended captain Nigar Sultana amid poor batting form in the Women's World Cup 2025. The team remains hopeful of a strong comeback in their next match against South Africa.

India head coach eyes bowling depth, addresses dot ball concerns post AUS loss India women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has said that the team will look to add bowling depth heading ahead in the tournament after their 3-wicket defeat against Australia in the Women's World Cup 2025.

Batting woes, 6th bowler issue: Harmanpreet Kaur says India has much to fix India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that the late batting order collapse let the team down in their agonising loss to Australia in Vizag on Sunday, October 12. Australia secured a record win after chasing down 331 in 49 overs.

How Alyssa Healy negated Sree Charani threat to down India Women's World Cup, IND vs AUS: Alyssa Healy scored a match-winning 142 to lead Australia to a record run-chase of 331 against India, carefully targeting bowlers around key threat Sree Charani.

Alyssa Healy storm hits Vizag, sinks India in record chase Captain Alyssa Healy smashed a jaw-dropping 142 as Australia pulled off the highest-ever chase in women's ODI history, hunting down 331 against hosts India in front of a roaring crowd at the ACA-VDCA Stadium on a Super Sunday to remember.

Premier League: Florian Wirtz's slow Liverpool start defended by Nagelsmann Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann called for patience with Liverpool's Florian Wirtz as he struggles to adapt to the Premier League. The German midfielder is yet to record a goal or assist in his first seven league matches after arriving from Bayer Leverkusen for a club-record fee.

South Africa ready for tough spin challenge against Bangladesh: Tumi Sekhukhune South Africa seamer Temi Sekhukhune has said that they're wary of the Bangladesh spin challenge ahead of their clash in the Women's World Cup 2025 in Visakhapatnam.

Not dwelling too much on win over India, every game important for us: Sekhukhune South Africa seamer Tumi Sekhukhune said that they will not dwell too much on their thrilling victory against India and treat every game equally ahead of their fixture against Bangladesh in Visakhapatnam.

AIFF adopts new constitution, leaves out two clauses for SC clarification: Report The All India Football Federation has adopted the Supreme Court-approved constitution, leaving two contentious clauses pending. This move comes amid a FIFA deadline and ahead of the upcoming AIFF elections, creating uncertainty around governance reforms.

Premier League: Florian Wirtz's slow Liverpool start defended by Nagelsmann Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann called for patience with Liverpool's Florian Wirtz as he struggles to adapt to the Premier League. The German midfielder is yet to record a goal or assist in his first seven league matches after arriving from Bayer Leverkusen for a club-record fee.

AIFF adopts new constitution, leaves out two clauses for SC clarification: Report The All India Football Federation has adopted the Supreme Court-approved constitution, leaving two contentious clauses pending. This move comes amid a FIFA deadline and ahead of the upcoming AIFF elections, creating uncertainty around governance reforms.

Kuldeep Yadav's mystery spinner element makes him dangerous: Ryan ten DoeschateIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate has said that the mystery spinner element makes Kuldeep Yadav a dangerous bowler after his fine performance in the Delhi Test. Kuldeep picked up five wickets against West Indies on Sunday, October 12.

IND vs WI: Did India plan to bat again in Delhi Test? Ten Doeschate respondsIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said that the hosts thought about batting again before enforcing the follow-on on West Indies during the Delhi Test. India bowled out West Indies for 248 in the first innings but struggled to get wickets in the second one.

Shan Masood, captain of India: Shaun Pollock makes big blunder on commentaryDuring live coverage of the opening Test between Pakistan and South Africa at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium, former South Africa all-rounder Shaun Pollock mistakenly described Shan Masood as the 'captain of India.' The clip of the incident has been going viral on social media.

IND vs AUS: Mandhana, Pratika power India to their highest total in Women's World CupSmriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal's opening stand helped India record their highest-ever total in Women's World Cups in the clash against Australia. The hosts, however, suffered a late collapse which allowed the Aussies to comeback into the contest.

Jayden Seales fined for 'dangerous' throw at Yashasvi Jaiswal in DelhiWest Indies pacer Jayden Seales has been sanctioned with a 25% match fee deduction and awarded a demerit point by the ICC after his throw struck India's Yashasvi Jaiswal on the pad in the second Test in Delhi.

Grandpa and Grandma would be proud: Vacherot in tears after beating cousin RinderknechValentin Vacherot claimed his maiden ATP Tour title at the 2025 Shanghai Masters, defeating cousin Arthur Rinderknech. His historic win as the lowest-ranked Masters 1000 champion highlights a remarkable journey filled with emotion and resilience.

Ramiz Raja's bizarre comment on Babar Azam in Lahore Test goes viralPAK vs SA, 1st Test: Ramiz Raja was heard making a bizarre comment when Babar Azam sent one LBW decision upstairs on Day 1 of the opening Test against South Africa at Gaddafi Stadium.

Neeru Pathak's uphill sprint: On spikes, sacrifice, and salvationNeeru Pathak chases her dreams on the track while carrying the weight of her family's hopes — a teenage sprinter running against odds, time, and uncertainty.

Jayden Seales fined for 'dangerous' throw at Yashasvi Jaiswal in DelhiWest Indies pacer Jayden Seales has been sanctioned with a 25% match fee deduction and awarded a demerit point by the ICC after his throw struck India's Yashasvi Jaiswal on the pad in the second Test in Delhi.

His historic win as the lowest-ranked Masters 1000 champion highlights a remarkable journey filled with emotion and resilience.

Neeru Pathak's uphill sprint: On spikes, sacrifice, and salvationNeeru Pathak chases her dreams on the track while carrying the weight of her family's hopes — a teenage sprinter running against odds, time, and uncertainty.

IND vs AUS: Mithali Raj stand, Ravi Kalpana gate unveiled at Vizag stadiumMithali Raj and Ravi Kalpana were honoured by the Andhra Cricket Association (ACA) as the they got a stand and a gate named after them respectively. Mithali had a storied career for India in women's international cricket.

Abhishek Sharma won't last six balls: Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah makes bold claimPakistan pacer Ihsanullah believes that Abhishek Sharma would not last an over from him and would get him dismissed in just three balls. This comes after India's recent win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 tournament.

IND vs WI: West Indies batters show up too little too late as India remain in commandIND vs WI 2nd Test Day 3: The West Indies put up a rare fightback in the second innings. But it might prove to be futile considering the deficit left to go as India holds control in the Test.

Out of my comfort zone: Former NZ coach Gary Stead ready for Andhra challengeGary Stead said that the job as the new Andhra coach is out of his comfort zone but is eager for the new challenge. Stead took over as the new Andhra red-ball coach after his tenure with New Zealand came to an end.

IND vs AUS: Mandhana climbs mount 1000, breaks multiple records in women's ODIsSmriti Mandhana created history as she became the first player in women's ODIs to score 1000 runs in a calendar year. Mandhana reached the landmark during the match against Australia in Vizag.

BSF's Kashmir Push: Wular Marathon Draws Thousands for Fitness & PeaceThis special report focuses on the Wular Marathon, organized by the Border Security Force (BSF) in Bandipora, North Kashmir, to promote physical fitness, environmental awareness, and positive engagement among the youth. 'If I ran, I ran for myself, to maintain my health,' said one national awardee teacher, who passionately urged more women to participate in such events for their well-being. The marathon, held on the banks of Wular Lake, saw hundreds of participants across 5 km, 10 km, and 21 km categories. Speakers like advocate Saika Rashid highlighted the event's positive message, encouraging youth to stay away from drugs and participate in constructive activities. The report also notes this event precedes a larger international Kashmir Marathon organized by the J&K government.

Brian Lara makes hilarious request to Delhi Test hero Yashasvi JaiswalWest Indies legend Brian Lara had fans smiling after the Delhi Test as he made a hilarious request to India's Yashasvi Jaiswal, who tormented Caribbean bowlers with his stunning 175-run knock.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
